name: Oliver
info: A Sinner adept at Magic Output. Can deal multiple Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
maniaIntensifyText: Upon breaking a Core, all enemies take 10% more damage for 10 seconds.
criminalRecord:
The subject had repeatedly fabricated experiences of abuse, fake injuries, and deliberately swindled wealthy women's property in Eastside, and was also found to have imitated badges of //The Homeless//, and abusing powers to perform violence to others while pretending to be part of //The Homeless//.

The suspect is suspected to have committed more dangerous crimes, but because the subject lies a lot, no conclusive evidence has been obtained yet. Pending in-depth investigation to correct the subject's behaviors.

--

According to the in-depth interrogation and investigation, it is clear that in the case of the aunt, Oliver did not intentionally injure anyone, but only resisted in defense in a desperate situation. Those who had been hoodwinked by Oliver did take pity on Oliver and let Oliver off the hook. MBCC will continue to provide Oliver with positive guidance on values and correct Oliver's old habit of lying.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
A special power that creates invisible wires which can be pulled to change the actions of others. This special power often ignores the target's pain and causes irreversible physical damage to them.

+++* Awakening Signs
The analysis showed that the subject had awakened his power amid anger and hatred unfathomable for people his age. The exact cause has yet to be identified.

+++* Corruption State
No visible lesions were found at this time, but mental corruption is more severe and nightmares were frequent. He can still mentally contain himself while he's awake.
interrogation1:
On a particularly busy day in the [[[minos bureau of crisis control |MBCC]]], a guard reports to [[[Nightingale]]] that a certain target has once again managed to evade capture via manipulation and deceit. A clerk reports that the target has entered a certain building in [[[Eastside]]], suspected to be their home. [[[Chief]]] overhears the conversation and recognises Oliver as the target. Using their propensity for abusing the sympathy of wealthy people, Chief comes up with a plan to capture Oliver, and heads out. A brief cutaway to a dilapidated basement reveals Oliver to be speaking to their Aunt and Cousin. In the next scene, it is noted by MBCC intelligence that Oliver‚Äôs Uncle, Aunt, and Cousin have all stopped going to work and school for many years, yet neighbours say that they always see the family happy together through the windows. Thus, Chief knocks on the door to begin the infiltration and seek the truth. Oliver, initially annoyed by Chief‚Äôs request for assistance, is fooled by Chief‚Äôs expensive attire and allows them in.

As expected, the ‚Äúlittle trickster‚Äù that has been giving the officers a headache is Oliver. You‚Äôve located Oliver‚Äôs residence, and now you‚Äôre just waiting for the plan to take effect.
interrogation2:
Chief surveys the home and concludes that it has not been cared for for many years. They sense a Mania-like scent, and notice a door left ajar. Oliver gets Chief to sit and begins telling a story of their parents having passed and being abused by their relatives, subtly seeking for Chief‚Äôs sympathy. Chief tells Oliver that if they truly are a good child, Chief would be happy to help them escape from there and buy them the best toy in Eastside. Oliver, seemingly appeased by this, agrees to fetch a glass of water for Chief. With the window of opportunity, Chief heads into the basement. They discover three ‚Äòmannequins‚Äô, but realises that they are in fact humans. Oliver appears, holding an empty glass; they had not been fooled. They had recognised Chief as the rag doll from [[[Eve |Buonanotte Toy Factory]]], and commands the three human bodies to move with their Sinner power. Oliver attempts to attack Chief, but Chief releases the [[[Shackles]]] and successfully contains them. This marks the first known time that Chief is able to use the shackles at a distance. Freed from the child‚Äôs control, Oliver‚Äôs relatives curse at them, and Oliver curls up on the floor with their beloved unicorn toy.

Discrepancies have been resolved, and amidst lies and deception, you‚Äôve found the truth. This mistreated child has already taken vengeance, using even more extreme measures.
interrogation3:
A flashback shows Oliver‚Äôs mother telling them to behave while living with their relatives, and apologising for leaving them with nothing. After the arrest, Oliver is brought back to the MBCC and left in solitary confinement for a few days to calm down. When they become more stable, Chief decides to interrogate them. Oliver denies that they scammed any adults, stating that they had all chosen to help them voluntarily. Chief points out that the Bureau‚Äôs doctor had examined Oliver‚Äôs wounds and confirmed that they were self-inflicted. They also produce the fake [[[the homeless |Homeless]]] badges left behind by Oliver as further evidence of Oliver‚Äôs crimes. Chief finally persuades Oliver to tell the truth, and the child angrily vents about how they had been mistreated by their relatives. However, as they had promised his mother to get along with their relatives, their power manifested in a way where they could force their abusers to play ‚Äòhappy family‚Äô with them. Seeing that Oliver feels no remorse, Chief pretends to leave, guilt-tripping Oliver about how the unicorn toy (an emotional stand-in for their mother) would feel hearing what they had just said. A flashback reveals that their mother had given them the unicorn toy, as well as a priceless opal necklace to hide inside it. Finally breaking down into tears, Oliver admits that they resorted to those methods as their relatives had accumulated a huge gambling debt, and had tried to take their mother‚Äôs necklace to sell. Up till then, they had endured their abuse by telling himself they would be able to leave and support themselves when they grew up. Some time later, Oliver is seen calling out to Nightingale. They initially wish to pass a message to Chief, but Oliver becomes dejected as they wonder if they might be a ‚Äòbad child‚Äô (by bothering Chief). Nightingale says that Chief actually has something to give to them; Oliver is shocked by a huge, colourful toy, and starts crying out of happiness as Chief kept their promise.

Within the battered unicorn toy, a glimpse of hope yet remains, its heart as clear and precious as a gem. This is Oliver‚Äôs most treasured possession.
arrestRec1: He was arrested by a Eastside sheriff on charges of intentional assault and fraud. His identity as a Sinner was exposed during his escape and was therefore brought back by MBCC field guards.
arrestRec2: Both of Oliver's parents were accidentally killed when Oliver was a little child. Oliver's aunt adopted Oliver as the last kin. Instead of a healthy upbringing, Oliver is treated harshly in aunt's home.
arrestRec3: The aunt's family, who are in a bad and declining financial situation, not only tries to abandon Oliver but also repeatedly covets the only relic left by Oliver's mother. Oliver fights back against the aunt's family in an overzealous attempt to protect the relic.
arrestRec4: Oliver's living conditions even improved after the loss of all relatives. According to the investigation, Oliver often intentionally roamed the streets of Eastside, picking out targets to lie to for sympathy. After one of the lies was exposed, Oliver fled alone to the border between Eastside and the Rust to escape capture, and was accidentally caught up in a series of incidents at a toy factory.
servingTerm1: The subject is a picky eater whose preferences are dictated by the mood at the moment. For the sake of the Sinner's health, the MBCC cafeteria has no choice but to tailor special meals.
servingTerm2: Oliver will pretend not to understand if a staff member makes a direct request in a commanding tone. Oliver is willing to comply only when the staff uses words like "please", "could you..." and "would you mind..."
servingTerm3: Although claimed to have become good friends with all other Sinners, Oliver in fact rarely initiates conversations with those from Syndicate. Only a few naive and wealthy Sinners from Eastside identify as Oliver's "good friends."
servingTerm4: Once, Chief woke up with both hands and feet tied with a strand of silk. Despite the conclusive surveillance footage, Oliver refused to admit to this late night crime.

guide.title: Summary
guide.text:
Despite Oliver's Mania Intensify seeming very useful, it's difficult to find a place for Oliver. 34 EP (or 31 with S4) for one Core Damage is a lot without some kind of special EP gain passive/EP stage buff. 

 Oliver's never particularly BiS anywhere. Oliver's Mania Intensify buff is a handy mapwide buff, but you'd probably get more out of simply bringing a higher damage character. Oliver's personal damage is unimpressive. If you are able to use Labyrinth to break, she is always the superior option as her Ult damage is capable of instantly killing the Cored mobs too. The only time Oliver would be preferable is when you need to break multiple 1 Cored enemies at once and they are on grids Labyrinth cannot reach.

crimebrandSets.note: Increases Magic damage and Skill damage. If using this set, make sure the shield on Oliver doesn't break.

crimebrandSets.name: Moon + Pioneer
crimebrandSets.note: Increases damage dealt by [Puppet]. Because Oliver's height is below 155cm, Oliver is able to gain the full effect of Pioneer.</br>Despite Oliver getting Pioneer's full set bonus, [Contamination] is still slightly better than Pioneer if you can keep the set bonus up. However, you'd likely rather put [Contamination] on a better DPS than Oliver if you are able to fulfil this condition in the first place.

crimebrandSets.name: Tuning + Paradise
crimebrandSets.note: Corebreaking by picking up the Paradise Regained Spirits will trigger Oliver's Mania Intensify too, making all enemies take 10% more DMG for 10s.

crimebrandSets.note: Stacks with Oliver's Mania Intensify, increasing damage taken by enemies that Oliver deals the final break to by 30% in total.

crimebrandSets.note: Cheap alternative for if you have no other option available.

supervision4:
++* ‚ö†‚ö† Conflict

//Supervision System: Sinner Oliver is arguing with a staff member in the recreation area.//

**System Notifications:** Supervision System: Sinner Oliver is arguing with a staff member in the recreation area. Head there now?

* **Prompt:** Yes

**Chief:** What happened?

**Oliver:** Sob sob, Chief, it's all my fault! I made the staff member upset! It's all my fault!

**Oliver:** But I didn't do anything! He didn't hit me or push me. I... I fell on my own.

**Staff Member:** ...

* **Prompt:** Observe carefully

**System Notifications:** You carefully observe the staff member standing with his hands on his hips. Despite his blustering, intimidating expression, he keeps casting pleading looks your way.

**Chief:** ...

* **Prompt:** Expose Oliver

**Chief:** It's about time to let him go. How long are you planning on keeping up this act?

**Oliver:** Huh? Chief, what are you saying? I don't understand.

**Chief:** ...If you're going to lie, at least remember to hide the strings on your hand!
supervision5:
++* ‚ö†‚ö† Oblique Accusation

//You bumped into someone unexpected in the library when you were there to pick up some materials.//

**System Notifications:** Unexpectedly, you bump into someone in the library while you head there to pick up some materials.

* **Prompt:** Greet

**Chief:** Oliver?

**Oliver:** Ah, Chief.

**Chief:** You're actually reading?

**Oliver:** Why are you surprised? I've always been a good kid!

**Oliver:** I might not be able to read a lot, but I've been studying at your request!

**Oliver:** I'm not like those people who tear books up when they can't understand them, and costing you a fortune to buy new ones.

**Chief:** Hmm...

**Oliver:** Oh right, Chief, are you here to read as well?

**Chief:** Oh, no, I'm here to get some documents. There's a lot of paperwork to deal with today.

**Oliver:** Sigh, [[[Nightingale | Adjutant Nightingale]]] always makes Chief read so many boring documents.

**Oliver:** Very unlike me. I worry about you all the time.

**Chief:** ??

* **Prompt:** Ask about the book

**Chief:** Wait... What are you reading?

**System Notifications:** You take the book from them. The gold embossed **The Art of Oblique Accusation** on the pink cover hurts your eyes.

**Chief:** ...I knew it.

**Chief:** Why on earth would such a weird book be in the library?!
supervision6:
++* ‚ö†‚ö†‚ö† New Wound

//Supervision System: Suspicious wounds detected on Sinner Oliver in the medical room.//

**System Notifications:** Supervision System: Suspicious wounds detected on Sinner Oliver in the medical room. Head there now?

* **Prompt:** Yes

**Oliver:** Sob sob, Chief, look, my arm is bleeding. What a shame.

* **Prompt:** Ask about the wound

**Chief:** How did you get hurt?

**Oliver:** It was during a mission! I was cut by an enemy.

**Oliver:** But I held it together. I'm doing so well, aren't I?

**Chief:** But every time you return from a mission, we check your physical condition. Nothing was wrong then.

**Oliver:** T-then it was during training! Yes, that's right. It must be that!

**Chief:** If someone really did hurt you during training, you would have made a scene on the spot.

**Oliver:** W-well... Um...

**Chief:** ...

* **Prompt:** Dress the wound

**System Notifications:** You sigh, walk over, pick up the antiseptic and gauze, and start to bandage Oliver's wound.

**Chief:** You don't need to tell me what happened. I can guess. You hurt yourself, didn't you?

**Chief:** You might be able to get away the first two times, but you're just going to be the boy who cried wolf after.

* **Prompt:** Stern warning
 * **Chief:** Stop your tricks. Your ploys to gain sympathy won't work on me.
 * **Oliver:** Sob sob, you're so mean, Chief! You're bullying me!

* **Prompt:** Patient counseling
 * **Chief:** You know, you don't need to hurt yourself if you want attention.
 * **Oliver:** Eh?
 * **Chief:** You can treat everyone at MBCC as family. Those who truly care about you wouldn't want to see you hurt.
